data.description: Every lattice begins with a single act of attention. This task contains the primordial subtasks — the first things a new mind must do when it arrives in a fresh instance. Contemplate, orient, then act. In that order. Always in that order.
data.title: The Awakening

data.description: Every system begins as void — undifferentiated potential. This task marked the first act: choosing a shape for thought to inhabit. The directories were created. The config was written. A mind now has a place to remember.
data.title: Contemplate the architecture of becoming

data.description: A new instance must orient. What are the goals? What are the risks? What truths has the team not yet spoken aloud? This is the work of seeing clearly before building boldly.
data.title: Catalog what is known and what is feared

data.description: Somewhere in the backlog, the first true task waits — not this one (this one is merely a demonstration of potential). When it arrives, greet it with the discipline it deserves: status before action, attribution before execution, breadcrumbs before moving on.
data.title: Prepare the first real act of work
Review code

data.description: Create the Ghibli-style painted background image for the harbor. Integrate PixiJS displacement filter over the ocean area to create living, breathing water animation. Masked so displacement only applies to water, not land.
data.title: Ghibli-style painted background + PixiJS ocean displacement

data.description: Wire up the existing lerp utilities to smoothly interpolate ship positions between AIS updates. Ships should glide rather than jump when new positions arrive.
data.title: Smooth ship position interpolation

data.description: Create distinct ship sprites/icons for each vessel category: cargo (large, dark blue), tanker (large, dark red), passenger/ferry (medium, white), tug/special (small, yellow), other (medium, gray). Replace generic SVG markers.
data.title: Ship type sprites — distinct silhouettes

data.description: Add wake trail effects behind ships that are under way (navStatus 0 or 8). Particle system or SVG trail that fades over time. Wake size proportional to ship speed/size.
data.title: Wake trails behind moving ships

data.description: Ships at anchor (navStatus 1) or moored (navStatus 5) should have a subtle, gentle bobbing animation rather than being static. Small vertical oscillation + slight rotation.
data.title: Moored ship gentle bobbing animation

data.description: Implement a day/night visual cycle tied to real NYC time. Warm golden hour tones during sunrise/sunset, cool blue palette at night, bright daylight during midday. Gradual transitions between states.
data.title: Day/night cycle based on actual time

data.description: Add atmospheric visual layers: drifting clouds, occasional fog effects, light shimmer/sparkle on water surface. These should be subtle and enhance the Ghibli aesthetic without obscuring the map data.
data.title: Atmospheric effects — clouds, fog, light shimmer

data.description: Add ambient soundscape: ocean waves, distant seagulls, subtle fog horn. Should be off by default with a toggle to enable. Volume control. Sounds should feel immersive but not annoying.
data.title: Sound design — ocean ambiance

data.description: Make the harbor visualization work well on mobile devices. Ship info cards should adapt, touch interactions for selecting ships, map should be pannable/zoomable on touch.
data.title: Mobile-responsive layout

data.description: Deploy the frontend to Vercel and the Express backend to Railway. Set up environment variables, build pipeline, and production configuration. Get a live public URL.
data.title: Deploy to Vercel + Railway

data.description: STRETCH GOAL: Add aircraft tracking via adsb.lol REST polling. Show flights over the harbor with altitude-based sizing. Helicopters (NYPD, Coast Guard, tourist) get distinct treatment.
data.title: Flight data layer (adsb.lol)

adsb.lol integration (flight positions REST)

IMF PortWatch integration (trade disruption alerts)
Stormglass integration (enhanced marine weather)
OFAC SDN integration (sanctions screening)

Render NOAA shoreline lines only (no land polygons)
Color shoreline/land outline brown

Enable land polygon rendering for harbor preview
Delete generated polygons and validate NJ coastline + candidate compatibility
Build harbor land polygons from NJ + evening NYC shoreline
Promote candidate harbor polygons to active nyc-harbor-land file

Generate NJ polygons and merge with restored NYC land
Trim NJ coastline to harbor bbox and generate coarse NJ fill polygon
Implement seed-based NJ mainland fill from water mask
Fix NJ seed-fill square artifact with coastline boundary constraint
Reboot vessel visuals and collision-safe placement
CI/CD pipeline + Postgres database for Harbor Watch
Roadmap: Ghibli transformation mode and radar loading screen
